Result.Abstract: We outline Ladyman's 'metaphysical' or 'ontic' form of structuralrealism and defend it against various objections. Cao, in particular, has questioned theview of ontology presupposed by this approach and we argue that by reconceptualisingobjects in structural terms it offers the best hope for the realist in thecontext of modern physics.

Result.Title: The Reasonable Effectiveness of Mathematics: Partial Structures and the Application of Group Theory to Physics

Result.Title: Superconductivity and structures: revisiting the London account

Result.Title: Scribbling on the blank sheet: Eddington's structuralist conception of objects

Result.Abstract: A general framework is proposed for accommodating the recent results of studies into ‘natural’ decision making. Result.Title: The interdependence of structure, objects and dependence

Result.Title: Modeling obsolete computer stock under regional data constraints: An Atlanta case study
